questions.text: What is the correct syntax to print a message in the console?
questions.explanation: The correct method to print to the console is console.log().

questions.text: Which keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: var, let, and const are used to declare variables in JavaScript.

questions.text: Which data type is NOT a primitive in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Objects are reference types, not primitives.

questions.text: Which symbol is used for single-line comments?
questions.explanation: JavaScript uses // for single-line comments.

questions.text: What is the output of '2' + 2 in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The number 2 is coerced into a string, resulting in string concatenation.

questions.text: What is the result of typeof null in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: This is a well-known bug in JavaScript; typeof null returns 'object'.

questions.text: Which method is used to parse a JSON string?
questions.explanation: JSON.parse() is used to convert a JSON string into an object.

questions.text: What does the 'this' keyword refer to inside a regular function?
questions.explanation: In non-strict mode, 'this' refers to the global object in regular functions.

questions.text: Which of the following is a falsy value?
questions.explanation: 0 is a falsy value, while [] and {} are truthy.

questions.text: Which array method executes a function on each array element?
questions.explanation: forEach runs a callback on each element of the array.

questions.text: Which concept does JavaScript use to allow a function to access variables from its outer scope?
questions.explanation: Closures allow functions to retain access to their lexical scope.

questions.text: Which method is used to deeply clone an object in modern JavaScript?
questions.explanation: This method creates a deep clone of objects without functions or circular refs.

questions.text: What is the output of `Promise.resolve(5).then(console.log)`?
questions.explanation: The resolved value is passed to the .then() callback.

questions.text: What does the 'async' keyword before a function declaration signify?
questions.explanation: Async functions always return a Promise.

questions.text: Which operator is used to handle errors in async/await syntax?
questions.explanation: try/catch blocks are used to catch errors in async/await.

questions.text: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language.

questions.text: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag defines a hyperlink.

questions.text: Which HTML element is used to define the title of a document?
questions.explanation: The <title> tag sets the document title shown in the browser tab.

questions.text: What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
questions.explanation: is used to insert a line break.

questions.text: Which attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for images.

questions.text: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to style HTML elements.

questions.text: Which HTML tag is used to link an external CSS file?
questions.explanation: <link> is used in the <head> to connect external stylesheets.

questions.text: Which property is used to change the text color?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property defines the text color.

questions.text: How do you add a background color in CSS?
questions.explanation: 'background-color' is the correct CSS property.

questions.text: Which symbol is used to select a class in CSS?
questions.explanation: A class selector starts with a period (.) in CSS.

questions.text: Which unit is relative to the font-size of the parent element?
questions.explanation: em is relative to the parent's font size.

questions.text: What is the default position value of an HTML element?
questions.explanation: By default, HTML elements have a static position.

questions.text:
How do you apply a style to all

elements inside a

?
questions.explanation:
The space selector targets all

inside

regardless of depth.

questions.text: Which property controls the stacking order of elements?
questions.explanation: z-index determines the vertical stacking order.

questions.text: What does the 'inherit' keyword do in CSS?
questions.explanation: 'inherit' forces the property to use the parent's value.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a valid display value?
questions.explanation: 'collapse' is used in tables, not general layout.

questions.text: What does the ':' pseudo-class do?
questions.explanation: : is used to exclude a selector from styling.

questions.text: Which CSS layout technique allows for 2D grid structures?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid is designed for 2D layouts.

questions.text: Which media query detects screen widths less than 600px?
questions.explanation: This is the correct syntax for max-width queries.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the 'contain' property in CSS?
questions.explanation: 'contain' helps browsers optimize rendering by isolating elements.

questions.text: What is React?
questions.explanation: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

questions.text: Which command creates a new React app using Create React App?
questions.explanation: npx create-react-app is the standard method to scaffold a React app.

questions.text: What is the correct file extension for a React component?
questions.explanation: .jsx is used for JavaScript files that contain JSX syntax.

questions.text: What does JSX stand for?
questions.explanation: JSX allows writing HTML in JavaScript.

questions.text: Which hook is used to add state to functional components?
questions.explanation: useState is the primary hook for state in functional components.
